channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Pope Leo tells 1 million Catholic youths they are sign 'different world is possible'
item.description: In his closing blessing for the Jubilee of Youth, Leo remembered the young people of Gaza and Ukraine and other countries "bloodied by war" who could not join their celebration.
item.content:encoded:
In his closing blessing for the Jubilee of Youth, Leo remembered the young people of Gaza and Ukraine and other countries "bloodied by war" who could not join their celebration.

(Image credit: Andrew Medichini)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Senate confirms ex-Fox News host Pirro as top federal prosecutor for nation's capital
item.description: The Senate confirmed ex-Fox News host Jeanine Pirro as top federal prosecutor for the nation's capital, after President Trump withdrew his controversial first pick, conservative activist Ed Martin Jr.
item.content:encoded:
The Senate confirmed ex-Fox News host Jeanine Pirro as top federal prosecutor for the nation's capital, after President Trump withdrew his controversial first pick, conservative activist Ed Martin Jr.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Who's the top dog? Wave-riding canines compete in the World Dog Surfing Championships
item.description: Pooches competed against similarly sized peers for a chance to appear in the finals. Additional heats featured multiple dogs surfing tandem or riding with people.
item.content:encoded:
Pooches competed against similarly sized peers for a chance to appear in the finals. Additional heats featured multiple dogs surfing tandem or riding with people.

(Image credit: Eakin Howard)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Chile's plunging birth rate may foreshadow future in U.S.
item.description: Chilean families are having only one child on average. U.S. birthrates are also dropping but it's unclear whether the U.S. will follow into the growing group of "very low" birthrate countries.
item.content:encoded:
Chilean families are having only one child on average. U.S. birthrates are also dropping but it's unclear whether the U.S. will follow into the growing group of "very low" birthrate countries.

(Image credit: Tamara Merino for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Senate heads home with no deal to speed confirmations as irate Trump tells Schumer to 'go to hell'
item.description: Without a deal in hand, Republicans say they may try to change Senate rules when they return in September to speed up the pace of confirmations.
item.content:encoded:
Without a deal in hand, Republicans say they may try to change Senate rules when they return in September to speed up the pace of confirmations.

(Image credit: Mariam Zuhaib)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Lebanon mourns beloved artist Ziad Rahbani
item.description: Lebanon has lost one of its most beloved artists, the playwright and musician Ziad Rahbani.
item.content:encoded: Lebanon has lost one of its most beloved artists, the playwright and musician Ziad Rahbani.
item.dc:creator: Michael Levitt

item.title: Do conservatives have a role in challenging Trump's foreign policy?
item.description: NPR's Sarah McCammon talks to Kori Schake of the American Enterprise Institute, about her recent piece in Foreign Affairs, Dispensable Nation: America in a Post-American World.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Sarah McCammon talks to Kori Schake of the American Enterprise Institute, about her recent piece in Foreign Affairs, Dispensable Nation: America in a Post-American World.
item.dc:creator: Erika Ryan

item.title: What's it like to cover your own network when it is in the headlines?
item.description: NPR's David Folkenflik shares what it's been like covering President Trump's contentious relationship with the media, including public media and NPR itself.
item.content:encoded: NPR's David Folkenflik shares what it's been like covering President Trump's contentious relationship with the media, including public media and NPR itself.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: 'From the Clinics to the Capitol' links anti-abortion movement to far-right extremism
item.description: NPR's Sarah McCammon speaks with Carol Mason about her new book, From the Clinics to the Capitol: How Opposing Abortion Became Insurrectionary.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Sarah McCammon speaks with Carol Mason about her new book, From the Clinics to the Capitol: How Opposing Abortion Became Insurrectionary.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Hodges

item.title: In Gaza, more Palestinians are killed while waiting for food aid
item.description: Dozens of Palestinians were killed, many while waiting for food aid, amid a deepening starvation crisis and despite Israeli assurances of a humanitarian pause in some areas of the territory.
item.content:encoded:
Dozens of Palestinians were killed, many while waiting for food aid, amid a deepening starvation crisis and despite Israeli assurances of a humanitarian pause in some areas of the territory.

(Image credit: Eyad Baba)
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy
